channel.title: Seller beware!
channel.description:
Fun4gold is a SCAM. I sold a couple accounts about 8 months back, they charged my paypal and my bank account went in the negative. I did not recover my accounts back. Do not sell or buy anything from them.
P.S. Chassy you were right.

item.title: Seller beware!
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I sold an account to previously known, Gold4RS, but now known as Gold4Fun about two years ago. Everything went fine and a year later, my brother decided to recover the account and I got my account back and found 144m on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Seller beware!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

How did I get away selling my account 4x to them?

Read full topic

item.title: Seller beware!
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

That’s a great idea silab. I’ll tell my bank to stop allowing paypal to take out money.

Read full topic

item.title: Seller beware!
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

not disputing your claim, however I just wanted to say if they fall into the negative paypal automatically reverses payments to others to cover the loses, you should contact them to see if that is the situation that occurred. I remember one time when I though using paypal was a good idea that I made a hosting payment with paypal and accepted some money for various things, someone did a chargeback and my paypal account fell into the negative, I was waiting for the dispute to be overturned but paypal had decided in all its wisdom to instead ask me to put some money into the account to simply reverse the hosting payment. Also just a protip you can request your bank to not allow paypal to withdraw funds from the account automatically.

Read full topic

item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

dang man im sorry.

Read full topic
